intro: Conyza pinnata, commonly known as the horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Its leaves are usually alternate, with a pinnate or bipinnate structure, giving it its scientific name. Conyza pinnata produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
